node.title: Man charged with murder of Abdul Kareem
node.description: A 35-year-old man will appear in the Hamilton District Court today charged with the murder of Auckland man Abdul Kareem.

node.title: Stocks close down for the week as markets eye Ukraine and Fed
node.description: Financial markets retreat in the face of rising tensions in Eastern Europe and an expected interest rate hike in the U.S.

node.title: Henry Cuellar tries to fend off progressive challengers in reelection bid
node.description: The congressional rematch between moderate incumbent Henry Cuellar and progressive challenger Jessica Cisneros is the first noteworthy House primary of the year.

node.title: Daunte Wright's mother angered by Kim Potter's smiling mug shot
node.description: Katie Wright brought up the mug shot as she addressed the court, saying it showed Potter wasn't genuinely sorry for his her son's death.

node.title: Suspended Columbia U. doctor sentenced for abusing former patient
node.description: The former patient addressed Joel Lavine in court, saying, "In hindsight I see how you groomed me for years since I was a minor in your care."

node.title: British diving instructor named as victim of fatal Sydney shark attack
node.description: A 35-year-old British diving instructor has been identified as the person killed in a shark attack off a Sydney beach, as officials reopened several beaches after the city's first fatal attack in 60…

node.title: Soaring U.S. car prices lead to sticker shock for buyers
node.description: Most new car buyers are having to pay thousands above automakers' suggested retail prices. Here's why.

node.title: The sport of Olympic pin trading
node.description: Collectors go for the gold in what is one of the most competitive of Olympics events: trading hard-to-find pins that commemorate the Games.

node.title: Big increase in kererū and pīwakawaka seen in New Zealand gardens - survey
node.description: New research shows there are significantly more kererū and pīwakawaka in our backyards than there were 10 years ago.

node.title: Surgeon general and his entire family test positive for COVID-19
node.description: The nation's top doctor has encouraged vaccines and boosters to fend off the worst of the virus.

node.title: Watch Live: Biden gives update on situation with Russia and Ukraine
node.description: The U.S. believes Russia is capable of attacking Ukraine any day.

node.title: Melania Trump launches a third NFT collection
node.description: Bidding for each item starts at $50, but "the artwork of each collection is revealed only after purchase," the former first lady said.

node.title: Onus on talent-laden Blues to seal Super Rugby Pacific title
node.description: Comment: After just a tick under three months since the All Blacks were crushed by France in Paris, today marks the start of the 2022 rugby season starting, Jamie Wall writes. Video

node.title: Kim Potter sentenced to 2 years for killing Daunte Wright
node.description: "To those who disagree and feel a longer prison sentence is appropriate, as difficult as it may be, please try to empathize with Ms. Potter's situation," the judge said.

node.title: Dabbling in crypto? You must tell IRS about these transactions
node.description: Millions of buyers and sellers of cryptocurrency will need to declare their digital currency transactions to the IRS.

node.title: Gisborne District Council appeals Land Valuation Tribunal decision on kiwifruit licences
node.description: In 2020 the council decided licenses to grow gold kiwifruit constituted an increase in value and therefore a rates increase. It's appealing a decision last week that the licences shouldn't been seen…

node.title: Peloton's Robin Arzón wasn't always an athlete – now she's a fitness icon to millions
node.description: Growing up, Robin Arzón was a kid who dreaded gym class. Then everything changed.

node.title: What took so long? Hostess offers caffeinated donuts
node.description: The company behind Twinkies and other sweet snacks adds the equivalent of a cup of coffee to its latest concoction.

node.title: Wife of Navy nuclear engineer in spy case pleads guilty
node.description: Diana Toebbe was accused of acting as a lookout for her husband as he tried to pass off nuclear submarine secrets.

node.title: Price spikes seen after U.S. bans Mexico avocados
node.description: A temporary U.S. ban on imports of the fruit already is hitting farm workers in Mexico. "You die of hunger," one picker said.

node.title: Cricket: White Ferns down India in dramatic finale
node.description: The White Ferns have beaten India by three wickets in today's one-day international in Queenstown.

node.title: Luke laments poor Māori pronunciation in television league coverage
node.description: The former New Zealand and Māori rugby league player Issac Luke says he was almost forced to watch the coverage of last weekend's All Stars rugby league match in Sydney "on mute".

node.title: Covid-19 update: 1929 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: The Ministry of Health is reporting 1929 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today.

node.title: Stressed Kentucky health care workers "scared to death of the future"
node.description: Across rural Kentucky, life has largely gone back to normal but the battle against the COVID-19 pandemic still rages inside health care facilities.

node.title: Olympic gold medalist Erin Jackson on historic win
node.description: Growing up in Ocala, Florida, ice skating is not common, and Erin Jackson had not even stepped on an ice rink until 2016.

node.title: Widowed volunteers find love again in their 70s
node.description: "We had friends, we had family, we had fellow volunteers. We were going to be OK. And then – surprise – we bumped into each other."

node.title: Police start arresting "Freedom Convoy" protesters in Canadian capital
node.description: After a three-week, traffic-snarling siege of Ottawa, police have moved in to arrest protesters angry over the COVID-19 restrictions and tow away trucks.

node.title: Stafford, Rams will cover photographer's hospital bills after she fell
node.description: Live broadcast of the Rams' Super Bowl celebration showed Stafford turning his back as the photographer fell from stage.

node.title: Family that died on mountain hike sent last, desperate text: "Help us"
node.description: The Mariposa County Sheriff's Office released information pulled from the cellphone of Jonathan Gerrish after months of work with an FBI forensics team.

node.title: Brad Pitt suing Angelina Jolie for selling shares of winery
node.description: Pitt says the French winery is his "passion," and claims Jolie purposefully kept the name of the buyer anonymous.
